A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From baptizo; a baptizer, as an epithet of Christ's forerunner.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
16.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
16.str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
And, even, also, namely.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wind, breath, spirit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

16.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
16.str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
A dove, pigeon. Of uncertain derivation; a pigeon.
And, even, also, namely.

16.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
16.str2: To come, go.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

17.str2: Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

17.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
17.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

17.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
17.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
17.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

17.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
17.str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.
